constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 43 (Monday, March 8, 2021)]
[House]
[Pages H1121-H1122]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. McHENRY:
H.R. 1645.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 3:
To regulate Commerce with foreign Nations, and among the
several States, and with the Indian Tribes.
Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18:
To make all Laws which shall be necessary and proper for
carrying into Execution the foregoing Powers, and all other
Powers vested by this Constitution in the Government of
[[Page H1122]]
the United States, or in any Department or Officer thereof.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

title: Protecting Consumer Access to Credit Act
